title: Flask complains a .env file exists when not using python-dotenv, even though that .env is a directory
raw_output: Issue 2823 reports Flask complaining about .env file existence when python-dotenv is not installed. The warning is shown even when the user intentionally doesn't use python-dotenv. Predicted files: (1) flask/cli.py - the CLI module that checks for .env files and shows the warning. (2) CHANGES.rst - changelog entry for behavior change. (3) tests/test_cli.py - CLI tests that cover dotenv behavior. Exploration: Matched flask/cli.py -> tests/test_cli.py.
